skillTree.localised_description: A horse! A horse! An acceptable amount of florins for a horse!

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: Respect my autoritah.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: The Goddess of Battle protects Her own.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Catrazza's companies have gathered much fame as reliable and efficient skirmishers, able to bring victory against all odds.

effects.description:
Leadership: +8 for Carabiniers, Cranequiniers and Handgunners units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +12% for Carabiniers, Cranequiniers and Handgunners units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -20% for all Regiments of Renown
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Kill not, waste not.
Knowledge that the enemy wallet might buy your troops out even before the first battle puts huge pressure to make sure it doesn't happen.
The so-called Birdmen of Catrazza (no relations) are a weird lot, to be sure, but they are good at scouting and at getting out of tight spots.

effects.description:
Speed and Missile strength: +15% for Birdmen of Catrazza (no relations)
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: Catrazza's political skills and calm demeanour has led a few to forget he once was an able captain of venture, and a quick fencer at that.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Guardian" for Duellists and Montante Swordsmen
	(all armies factionwide)

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_name: The Very Best Money Can Buy
skillTree.localised_description: Good equipment may make the difference between competent and successful mercenaries, or competent and dead ones. Everything is an investment towards the future.

effects.description: Missile strength: +15% for Paymaster Chest Wagons

skillTree.localised_description: It is good to be friends with most of the armed nobles of the region, and to always know who was in whose bedroom.

effects.description:
Recruitment and Upkeep cost: -10% for all heavy cavalry and other aristocratic units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +10 for cavalry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Once again, Tilea will be covered in marble and, most importantly, wealthy in money and people.

effects.description:
Stimulate Trade commandment: additional +5% Research rate
	(all provinces)

Stimulate Trade commandment: additional -10% Construction cost for all buildings
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: The doubt that betrayal would hardly bring woes but even monetary incentives has turned the tables of many battles.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the goddess Myrmidia, if not a member outright. Myrmidia is an ascended mortal and the chief deity in the south, and the vast influence of her cults teach tactical acumen, mercy, and civilization.

effects.description: Replenishes 10% campaign movement range after winning a battle

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of Nahmud, if not a member outright. Although part of the vaster Myrmidian cults, the various sects of Nahmud favour equality and special education, and are somewhat too fond of secrecy.

By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of Sister Fury, if not a member outright. One of Myrmidia's companions in life, Fury's legacy is one of intense, violent, but controlled rage and violence against injustice and destruction.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the god Solkan, if not a member outright. The merciless god is one of the most ancient, and just as timeless is his unbridled retribution against the corrupted. His is currently a relatively awkward presence, strongest in Remas.

By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the god Morr, if not a member outright. The old god of the dead's legacy is one of fatalism and certainty, and finds its largest seat in Luccini.

effects.description:
Battle healing cap: -10%
	(enemy armies in local region)
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the goddess Shallya, if not a member outright. Her teachings of healing and compassion feel at odds with the world's grimness and darkness, which is also why many flock to her.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the goddess Verena, if not a member outright. Like her husband Morr, the blind deity's legacy is not only one of learning and justice, but also one of detached impartiality.

By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the god Ranald, if not a member outright. He is one of many and sometimes darker aspects, but the lord of fortune was also the only one who could make Morr smile. Somewhat.

ui_effects.localised_text: Grants one of the listed effects at random

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, its not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
Perhaps risen from the lowest ranks, this commander is in his own environment when leading mercenary companies, just as a dolphin plays on the waves.
With roots and allies among the most powerful and upright nobility, this Lord doesn't often meddle with unstable mercs. Who heard that.

Melee defence: +3 for all heavy cavalry and other aristocratic units
	(Lord's army)

Armour-piercing weapon damage: +2 for all heavy cavalry and other aristocratic units

skillTree.localised_description: Tileans are an odd bunch, known to fight to the last for the most disparate reasons: their ideals, their captain, their regiment, their purse, a painting.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

skillTree.localised_description: Well, this is straightforward enough.

skillTree.localised_description: Duck! Shoot! Duck! Shoot! Shoot- shoot, that was wrong.

skillTree.localised_description: The key is not letting your initiative depend on a lucky die.
It's seldom enough to have only some of your troops to be ready to take a beating. The enemy has their own plans.

skillTree.localised_description: "You kill them before they kill you, sonnie. That's all it is."

effects.description:
Melee attack: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Though of course, if they do stab you, you better know how to parry."

effects.description:
Melee defence: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Plus, you better kill them dead with the one shot you have."

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "And to do that, it helps if you put all your weight where it counts."

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +2% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Look, at the end of the day, you may be alive and you better learn from what didn't kill you."

effects.description:
Physical resistance: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Being supportive of the flourishing tilean art is prestigious, and prestige is lucrative.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Open the coffers, put up more signs. I want more cannons, pikes, even ogres, even those buggers with the paper wings. Everyone. I shall have that castle by tomorrow or by Myrmidia I will drown them in mercs."
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: Commerce is the life-blood of any economy, and the sea must be its heart.
A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: Such is the pinnacle of the tilean merchant prince and politician that seemingly anything can be handled.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

factionEffects.localised_description: A commercial and mercenary foothold in Cathay that would make Ricco and Robbio proud and jealous.
factionEffects.localised_title: Grand Embassy to the Grand Cathay

items.colour_text: An ancient elven blade, relic of a time when Tilea was an Asur colony. Its wielder's attacks leave a glowing and elegant trail of light and molten armour.
Catrazza is not usually one for religious displays, but there are solid practical and diplomatical advantages for wearing this ring around.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: An ancient elven blade, relic of a time when Tilea was an Asur colony. Its wielder's attacks leave a glowing and elegant trail of light and molten armour.
Catrazza is not usually one for religious displays, but there are solid practical and diplomatical advantages for wearing this ring around.
Money equals power, power equals money. Marinated in good manners and leverage, money can move mountains aside. And armies, especially armies.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +10 with Goldtooth and Western Provinces

Weapon strength: +10% for Duellists, Pikemen, Republican Guard and cavalry units
	(Lord's army)
